channel.title: Few questions about Ubuntu
channel.description:
Finally installed Ubuntu successfully... Took forever, and so many weird errors. Last time I tried to install it and the time before that, it wiped out my XP partition. Once on version 5.x.x and recently with version 6.0.6.
Finally got it to work though, and installed about 130 updates and now using a nice stable version. Alright, just a few questions if anyone could help. :)
How do I install firestarter? I checked on the website and it said type this in. sudo apt-get install firestarter
It doesn't work. It prompts me for the password, I enter it in, and then it says firestarter not found on E:\ drive. Does anyone know of another firewall, something better?
Any useful programs/games anyone could recommend? I'm totally new to this, I only spent about a week with the old version of Ubuntu and then the files got corrupted. :(

item.title: Few questions about Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @Gorlackgoo Gorlackgoo
item.description:
@Gorlackgoo wrote:

[quote=“ghostboy195, post:7, topic:6396”][quote author=Gorlackgoo link=topic=8747.msg94465#msg94465 date=1154004346]
Ubuntu isn’t awesome. Kill yourself now.
And use the installer Ubuntu has then using your terminal.
[/quote][quote author=Gorlackgoo link=topic=8747.msg98111#msg98111 date=1154093093]
You should delete Ubuntu.
[/quote]why do you hate ubuntu so much? i mean really, what has it done to you?[/quote]
It has done everything to me.

Read full topic

item.title: Few questions about Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

I got firestarter to work after I fixed the repository problems!

Firestarter is a Linux Firewall. Works great!

Read full topic

@ghostboy195 wrote:

ron, whats firestarter? btw, if your computer can handle it, you can dl americas army for linux

item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

Lol Gorlack, K/Ubunto may not be as good as Gentoo or some other distros., but it is still a good OS.

So did you get it working ok Ron? Or do you still need help?

item.title: Few questions about Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

I have no idea how to use that!!! lol

good news though, I asked on ubuntuforums.com instead and I got an answer really quickly. I rebooted, suddenly my optical mouse worked. And I renewed my debs file and now that works fine, and did the updates. And now I can finally install java and flash without an error and I’m happy.

Read full topic

item.title: Few questions about Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @Gorlackgoo Gorlackgoo
item.description:
@Gorlackgoo wrote:

It should help you. I’ve given you advice to delete Ubuntu and/or use the system installer.

Read full topic
